      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      java.lang.String clearanceCheck(int clearance)
      override of clearanceCheck method that turns an integer clearance to its String equivalent for display in the GUI
      int clearanceCheck(java.lang.String clearance)
      Method accepts the user clearance level pulled from GUI and converts it into an integer Integer representation of clearance is used for storing in the database 0 is an Admin level 1 is a Reviewer and has the second most privileges 2 is a DCP and has the third most privileges 3 is an Auditor which as of yet has not been implemented 4 is a User that has been terminated from the company and has no privileges

      • isValid

        public boolean isValid(java.lang.String username,
                       java.lang.String password)
                throws java.sql.SQLException,
                       java.lang.ClassNotFoundException
        Accepts String parameters representing the user's credentials entered via the UI. Authenticates the inputted credentials and returns the appropriate boolean. True for input that matches a row in the database. false otherwise
        Parameters:
        username - username inputted by the user. username must be unique (No duplicates in database).
        password - password inputted by the user. Case sensitive
        Returns:
        returns true if both username and password parameters match a row in the database. Otherwise it returns false
        Throws:
        java.sql.SQLException
        java.lang.ClassNotFoundException

      • select

        public UserLogic select(java.lang.Object username)
                 throws java.lang.ClassNotFoundException,
                        java.lang.ArrayIndexOutOfBoundsException,
                        java.sql.SQLException
        Accepts username from drop down list in the UI and pulls all the user information from the database.
        Parameters:
        username - username selected from the corresponding drop down list in the UI.
        Returns:
        populated UserLogic object
        Throws:
        java.lang.ClassNotFoundException
        java.lang.ArrayIndexOutOfBoundsException
        java.sql.SQLException

      • select

        public UserLogic select(int ID)
                 throws java.lang.ClassNotFoundException,
                        java.sql.SQLException
        Passes integer parameter to data access class for a query and returns resulting UserLogic object
        Parameters:
        ID - integer representing the user ID of a user
        Returns:
        Throws:

      • insertUser

        public void insertUser(java.lang.String username,
                       java.lang.String password,
                       java.lang.String firstName,
                       java.lang.String lastName,
                       java.lang.Object clearance)
                throws java.sql.SQLException,
                       java.lang.ClassNotFoundException
        populates this instance with the parameters passed and then passes this instance to a Data Access method for insertion into the database
        Parameters:
        username - String representing the username of a user
        password - String representing the password of a user
        firstName - String representing the first name of a user
        lastName - String representing the last name of a user
        clearance - Object representing the user level of the user. method casts clearance to a String before manipulating it
        Throws:
        java.sql.SQLException
        java.lang.ClassNotFoundException

      • updateUser

        public void updateUser()
                throws java.sql.SQLException,
                       java.lang.ClassNotFoundException
        Passes this instance to the User data access class to update the corresponding row in the database for the User. This method should only be called by an instance that has all of its variables already populated
        Throws:
        java.sql.SQLException
        java.lang.ClassNotFoundException

      • clearanceCheck

        public int clearanceCheck(java.lang.String clearance)
        Method accepts the user clearance level pulled from GUI and converts it into an integer Integer representation of clearance is used for storing in the database 0 is an Admin level 1 is a Reviewer and has the second most privileges 2 is a DCP and has the third most privileges 3 is an Auditor which as of yet has not been implemented 4 is a User that has been terminated from the company and has no privileges
        Parameters:
        clearance - String clearance variable pulled from the GUI.
        Returns:
        returns an Integer representation of Clearance to be stored in database

      • clearanceCheck

        public java.lang.String clearanceCheck(int clearance)
        override of clearanceCheck method that turns an integer clearance to its String equivalent for display in the GUI
        Parameters:
        clearance -
        Returns:
        String representation of the user's clearance level to be used in the GUI
